entries.entry: What is done out of love always takes place beyond good and evil. - Friedrich Nietzsche
Everyone has talent. What is rare is the courage to follow the talent to the dark place where it leads. - Erica Jong
The pride of youth is in strength and beauty, the pride of old age is in discretion. - Democritus
Genius has electric power which earth can never tame. - Lydia M. Child
Great ability develops and reveals itself increasingly with every new assignment. - Baltasar Gracian
Ability is of little account without opportunity. - Napoleon Bonaparte
The future, according to some scientists, will be exactly like the past, only far more expensive. - John Sladek
You may delay, but time will not. - Benjamin Franklin
I tend to live in the past because most of my life is there. - Herb Caen
Life wouldn't be worth living if I worried over the future as well as the present. - William Somerset Maugham
Let no one ever come to you without leaving better and happier. - Mother Teresa
Only in the agony of parting do we look into the depths of love. - George Eliot
Man's feelings are always purest and most glowing in the hour of meeting and of farewell. - Jean Paul Richter
Where is human nature so weak as in the bookstore? - Henry Ward Beecher
You can cover a great deal of country in books. - Andrew Lang
"Guts and tenacity" Try the same stage 10 Times
Genius may have its limitations, but stupidity is not thus handicapped. - Elbert Hubbard
People say that life is the thing, but I prefer reading. - Logan Pearsall Smith
Just the knowledge that a good book is awaiting one at the end of a long day makes that day happier. - Kathleen Norris
Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read. - Groucho Marx
Always read stuff that will make you look good if you die in the middle of it. - P. J. O'Rourke
Wear the old coat and buy the new book. - Austin Phelps
The multitude of books is making us ignorant. - Voltaire
Woe be to him that reads but one book. - George Herbert
The reading of all good books is like a conversation with the finest men of past centuries. - Rene Descartes
There is no mistaking a real book when one meets it. It is like falling in love. - Christopher Morley
Read much, but not many books. - Benjamin Franklin
Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans. - John Lennon
You can only be young once. But you can always be immature. - Dave Barry
Life is not fair; get used to it. - Bill Gates
Live always in the best company when you read. - Sydney Smith
Nothing changes your opinion of a friend so surely as success - yours or his. - Franklin P. Jones
The friendship that can cease has never been real. - Saint Jerome
Friends may come and go, but enemies accumulate. - Thomas Jones
The ornament of a house is the friends who frequent it. - Ralph Waldo Emerson
Be slow in choosing a friend, slower in changing. - Benjamin Franklin
Friendship make prosperity more shining and lessens adversity by dividing and sharing it. - Cicero
Talent wins games, but teamwork wins championships. - Michael Jordan
Misfortune shows those who are not really friends. - Aristotle
Nothing's better than the wind to your back, the sun in front of you, and your friends beside you. - Aaron Douglas Trimble
"Advanced worker bee" Gain 150 Star
"Professional worker bee" Gain 240 Star
"Challenger" Try the same stage 5 Times
Life is a risk. - Diane Frolov
If you don't find God in the next person you meet, it is a waste of time looking for him further. - Mahatma Gandhi
A friend is a second self. - Aristotle
Your happiness is defined by what makes your spirit sing. - Nancy Sullivan
No great man ever complains of want of opportunity. - Ralph Waldo Emerson
The moment of victory is much too short to live for that and nothing else. - Martina Navratilova
Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it. - Henry David Thoreau
You always pass failure on the way to success. - Mickey Rooney
Men are not prisoners of fate, but only prisoners of their own minds. - Franklin D. Roosevelt
Success is the ability to go from one failure to another with no loss of enthusiasm. - Sir Winston Churchill
The strongest of all warriors are these two -- Time and Patience. - Leo Tolstoy
One of the greatest victories you can gain over someone is to beat him at politeness. - Josh Billings
A man has to have a code, a way of life to live by. - John Wayne
Maturity is only a short break in adolescence. - Jules Feiffer
Life is far too important a thing ever to talk seriously about. - Oscar Wilde
"Don't give up!" Try the same stage 20 Times
Success isn't permanent, and failure isn't fatal. - Mike Ditka
While we stop to think, we often miss our opportunity. - Publilius Syrus
Luck is the residue of design. - Branch Rickey
The most potent muse of all is our own inner child. - Stephen Nachmanovitch
If you can concentrate always on the present, you'll be a happy man. - Paulo Cuelho
Education's purpose is to replace an empty mind with an open one. - Malcolm Forbes
It is possible to store the mind with a million facts and still be entirely uneducated. - Alec Bourne
The great aim of education is not knowledge but action - Herbert Spencer
Whoever ceases to be a student has never been a student. - George Iles
Education begins a gentleman, conversation completes him. - Thomas Fuller
Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance you must keep moving. - Albert Einstein
"Welcome!" First time of game access
"Come on in " connect game 10 times
"I've been waiting for you :)" connect game 30 times
He who can, does. He who cannot, teaches. - George Bernard Shaw
Not the senses I have but what I do with them is my kingdom. - Helen Keller
The tragedy of life is what dies in the hearts and souls of people while they live. - Albert Einstein
The journey is the reward. - Steve Jobs
Well begun is half done. - Aristotle
If we take care of the moments, the years will take care of themselves.
Rather be dead than cool. - Kurt Cobain
Everything in your world is created by what you think. - Oprah Winfrey
Appetite, with an opinion of attaining, is called hope; the same, without such opinion, despair. - Thomas Hobbes
Fear cannot be without hope nor hope without fear. - Baruch Spinoza
What we dwell on is who we become. - Oprah Winfrey
Perpetual optimism is a force multiplier. - Colin Powell
To want to be what one can be is purpose in life. - Cynthia Ozick
There is nothing like dream to create the future. Utopia to-day, flesh and blood tomorrow. - Victor Hugo
He who has never hoped can never despair. - George Bernard Shaw
He that lives upon hope will die fasting. - Benjamin Franklin
Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope and confidence. - Helen Keller
Total absence of humor renders life impossible. - Colette
Laughter is inner jogging. - Norman Cousins
For the things we have to learn before we can do them, we learn by doing them. - Aristotle
Idleness is not doing nothing. Idleness is being free to do anything. - Floyd Dell
Try not to become a man of success but rather try to become a man of value. - Albert Einstein
In preparing for battle I have always found that plans are useless, but planning is indispensable. - Dwight D. Eisenhower
Happiness lies in the joy of achievement and the thrill of creative effort. - Franklin D. Roosevelt
What is written without effort is in general read without pleasure. - Samuel Johnson
God doesn't require us to succeed; he only requires that you try. - Mother Teresa
You need chaos in your soul to give birth to a dancing star. - Friedrich Nietzsche
If I only had an hour to chop down a tree, I would spend the first 45 minutes sharpening my axe. - Abraham Lincoln
If you judge people, you have no time to love them. - Mother Teresa
The trouble with our times is that the future is not what it used to be. - Paul Valery
I wasted time, and now doth time waste me. - William Shakespeare
I never think of the future - it comes soon enough.
I think the prime reason for existence, for living in this world, is discovery. - James Dean
First weigh the considerations, then take the risks. - Helmuth von Moltke
Don't be afraid your life will end; be afraid that it will never begin. - Grace Hansen
"Now I know!" Gain 10 Star
"Beginner worker bee" Gain 30 Star
"Intermediate worker bee" Gain 90 Star
Is virtue a thing remote? I wish to be virtuous, and lo! Virtue is at hand. - Confucius
The secret of eternal youth is arrested development. - Alice Roosevelt Longworth
Everything that I understand, I understand only because I love. - Leo Tolstoy
Love is, above all else, the gift of oneself. - Jean Anouilh
Love is a gross exaggeration of the difference between one person and everyone else. - William Shakespeare
There is no remedy for love but to love more. - Henry David Thoreau
Life's greatest happiness is to be convinced we are loved. - Victor Hugo
Tis the most tender part of love, each other to forgive. - John Sheffield
All love that has not friendship for its base, is like a mansion built upon sand. - Ella Wheeler Wilcox
